list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The news gave us all a shock.

list_definition.definition: (often electric shock) the effect on the body of an electric current

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He got a slight shock when he touched the live wire.

list_definition.definition: a sudden blow coming with great force

list_definition.mean_english: tình trạng cực kì yếu đuối
list_definition.definition: a medical condition caused by a severe mental or physical shock

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was suffering from shock after the crash.

list_definition.definition: to give a shock to; to upset or horrify

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Everyone was shocked by his death
The amount of violence shown on television shocks me.

list_definition.definition: a bushy mass (of hair) on a person’s head.
